intro: Acronema tenerum, commonly known as the slender acronema, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forests or along stream banks. Due to its delicate appearance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens for ornamental purposes.
